page.title: 18FAUNA
page.content: Birdlife is quite remarkable for such a small area.The{great crested {grebe}and the{sedge}and{garden} {warblers}are to be seen at Loch Libo, as are large flocks of migrant{whooper {swans}throughout the winter. The woods of Caldwell Law are visited autumn and spring by large flocks of {redwing}and{fieldfare}.The{buzzard}has been a summer visitor and the{black} {grouse}is an ex-resident. {Roe deer ,moles}in plenty,{shrew, {hare}and{rabbits}are common wildlife. {Foxes}are still active but they are no longer a threat to farms as there is little free-ranging poultry. Recently our{badger}colony was wiped out by gun- and terrier-toting vandals though we hope the badger setts will be recolonised from outside the area.
